Description: Legalization of warrantless arrests by ICE and ICE-contracted agents
@theglutster breaks down ICE tactics we’ve been noticing lately.
updates via stories on ICE sightings

LAPD deploying approximately 300 vehicles to Exposition Park starting today, according to internal emails obtained by LA Public Press. The Natural History Museum notified staff that LAPD will use the park's Pink and Yellow parking lots "to stage vehicles and to check in their personnel" through early next week, per a message from Exposition Park Management.The museum's email to employees acknowledged the "visible presence may raise questions or concerns" and reminded staff that "LAPD is prohibited from engaging in immigration enforcement activities."Two LAPD public information officers told us they have no information about the operation. One officer noted that "doesn't mean it's not coming down the pipe," just that they haven't received any information on it as of yet.The nature of the operation requiring 300+ police vehicles was not specified in the communications. Exposition Park houses the California Science Center, Natural History Museum, and is adjacent to USC. The park is managed by the state of California.

The California Immigration Detention Database tracks formal complaints, also known as grievances, that people detained in California's immigration detention facilities have filed to seek redress against the inhumane conditions of their confinement.

On Tuesday night, Huntington Park police arrested a man who was impersonating a Border Patrol agent, immediately raising concern as many people have pointed out that some people posing as immigration agents are in fact bounty hunters and impersonators of federal agencies. A day later, the City of Huntington Park unanimously approved a resolution to verify federal agents’ identity when they are operating in the community.
